website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, yet exceedingly comfortable camping pad.
pros: Air cell design offers added support and comfort
Highly durable, weather resistant, and waterproof
Easy to setup and take down
Ultra lightweight and super compact when rolled
cons: Materials can be a bit noisy when shifting positions

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Ultralight can be yours!
customer_reviews.text: I recently gave my Thermarest to my girlfriend and was looking for an ultralight replacement. I was a little sceptical at first because of the cell design but I was very mistaken. This thing is incredible! I'm 6'2 and 220 and had one of the best night's sleep on an ultralight pad I've ever had. The valve design is epic. It has a one way large mouth valve that fills up quickly and doesn't leak at all in between breaths. Deflating it is as easy and popping your finger in there and squeezing out the air. I got it to pack right back down to the same size it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Love how small and lightweight this item is
customer_reviews.text: Love how small and lightweight this item is, but thats about all the good I have to share. The first time I used it, it sprung a leak which I was able to successfully fix with the included patch. The second time I used it, several more punctures occurred and it became completely useless, leading to some very cold uncomfortable nights. I was in an environment for an extended period of time where I was relying on this thing and it let me down in a big way. This items appears to sacrifice durability for size and weight. If you need something that's tough, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome night of sleep
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sleep pad. I am a side sleeper and always feel it in my hip. I slept great with no hip pain. I'm planning on buying one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold air, making it rather worthless as a sleeping pad.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to try this sleeping pad because it's so lightweight and packs small. However, it doesn't matter how light it is if it doesn't even hold air. I took it on a two day test trip before using it on a longer hike, and I'm so glad I did, because it only lasted an hour or two before it was completely flat. I will admit that it was very comfortable when it was fully inflated, but that short window of time definitely didn't make up for the rest of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Mama of Many

customer_reviews.title: One minor flaw - updated.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I have had no issues with it holding air, and I do find the extra length to be a bonus. I gave it 4 stars because for some reason, they put the air valve at the foot, not at the head. I suspect the person that designed this has not spent much time in a 1 person tent. Update: A few more days in the woods, and no problems at all. It did seem soft after the first night, but I think it just stretched, because it has been stable after that. No leaks, and a lot less noise than my NeoAir. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Al MashburnTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Came Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Product was purchased over a month ago for my sons summer campout. So it has been put away since. We arrived at camp today and opened our product to find it came damaged. It has some blue sticky residue on it, perhaps from the time of manufacturing. A shame because I own the same pad from some time ago and no issues. Sadly I am over my return window by 5 days. Will ad a pic once we are back from the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck. Inflates with about 15 breaths. Comfortable on the ground. Shields you from feeling every little leaf and twig under you. Obviously not best for very cold weather camping if you're needing this to help insulate you from cold ground. But for basic camping and down to about 45-50 degrees it works. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Basilone

customer_reviews.title: I took this product on a 2 day backpacking trip ...
customer_reviews.text: I took this product on a 2 day backpacking trip... God I wish I would have tested it before... It went flat 3-4 times a night. I checked for leaks, I didn't find any.. I finally gave up and slept on my jacket for more comfort.
customer_reviews.author: JAMESON

customer_reviews.title: Leaked upon first use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if mine had a hole or a faulty valve, but it would not hold air. It would be flat 30 minutes after laying on it. I brought it on a camping trip and slept miserably.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Artukovic

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product was great until it stopped staying inflated on its third use... in the middle of my trip. Frustrated that the return window has closed on this defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Young

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I assumed I would get something somewhat comfortable, I didn't expect bed comfort but this felt like laying a blanket on the ground. My wife and I both were not able to sleep. The second night I layed all my clothes on it to make it tolerable. Still was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Peter F. Dubois

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Doesn't hold air. We returned after just testing at home. You get what you pay.
customer_reviews.author: John Dupras

customer_reviews.title: provides no comfort
customer_reviews.text: feels like sleeping on the ground. very thin and spaces in between the diamond-shaped air sacs wreck your knees. Woke up feeling like I got hit by a truck. Have used other self-inflating pads backpacking in the past and they've far exceeded this one. Pass.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Yoga mat is better than this!
customer_reviews.text: Either the good reviews are fake or I received fake product. It's very thin and it doesn't hold much air. When you lie on the pad, your back hit the ground right the way. This inflated sleeping pad doesn't provide any support at all. I am soooo disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gorlank

customer_reviews.title: Returns for defects??
customer_reviews.text: Based on the many strong reviews, I purchased this mattress to take on a trip last year. On the first night it deflated completely within two hours, indicating it was defective from the start. I tried it again the following two nights with the same results, studying closely with friends trying to find the issue to no avail. I have searched amazon relentlessly to find a replacement policy with no success. Due to the many strong reviews i believe mine was just a fluke and would like to return it for a replacement before I head out for trips this summer. I understand this is beyond 30 days and apologize for the delay, was hoping you could still help?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and popped after one day
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ultra-light sleeping pad. Loved the design and looked like it was of quality. I was wrong. I set out to hike a section of the Pacific Crest Trail from Warner Springs to Cabazon. The first night the thing popped. I tried to repair it and the hole just grew bigger. Used about a half a small roll of tape to try and cover the hole. Ended up throwing the thing away once I arrived at the next trash can off the trail. Really was a bummer. I had to share a sleeping pad with my girlfriend and it just really sucked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SMALL
customer_reviews.text: THIS PAD IS SMALL!. It's the same size as the mummy sleeping bags so once you are on it you can not move or you fall off! Not enough padding in my opinion. The only way this worked for me was when i put the pad inside my sleeping bag so that way i didn't fall off of it. The only pro is that its a space saver.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wills

customer_reviews.title: Begins leaking almost immediately...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two weeks, comfortable and light weight. Immediately after that it began leaking slowly through the night. One year from purchase and used maybe 15 times, it won’t hold air overnight. Woke up at 3am two nights in a row now to find it completely deflated yet still fully plugged. Very disappointed with the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Fleck

customer_reviews.title: Useless item
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to use this item. The flap for inflation did not close when inflation device removed so the air would come out before seal could be closed.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: FAILED me in the Tetons!
customer_reviews.text: The first few nights I used this pad it worked as advertised and deserved a good review. However, on my second trip using this product it sprang a leak. I was able to locate the leaking spot and placed one of the provided repair patches on the pad. It didn’t work. I used the second patch and reinforced it with duct tape, still didn’t work. I slept for 4 nights backpacking in the Tetons without a pad and my body was not happy with me! I missed the amazon return deadline by one stinking day! I would consider another option.
customer_reviews.author: Jordo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based off the great review but it didn't hold up. Within a few days it deflated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend an extra $20 and go to REI
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t so much that it was uncomfortable but the lack of insulation and thinness make it, as the REI worker I spoke with explained to me, feel like you’re sleeping on a balloon and alllll that cold air is coming right up on you instead of your insulation keeping you warm. I think it would be great if it had better insulation (I got one about .5 in bigger rolled up from REI for 15 bucks more that kept me WAY warmer and has been worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: perfect little air mattress
customer_reviews.text: perfect little air mattress. I wanted something to sleep on that isnt the hard ground. super easy and quick to blow up. the hole nozzle is very smart so that air doesnt come out when you try and seal it. small so I can pack it away easily with little room
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Its inexpensive, comfortable and easy to inflate/deflate.
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable, extremely easy to inflate, and just as easy to deflate and seem very durable. We have 3 of them and have used them on three section hikes of the Appalachian Trail with not one issue. For the price you can't beat it. We have had more expensive sleeping pads and this on performs just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ami M Strong

customer_reviews.title: great for travelling
customer_reviews.text: it is great for travelling. Blows up with only few breaths and packs away in a small bag. the only thing I didn't like was the noise it makes when sleeping on it. It sounds too much like a plastic tarp. But that is a personla preference. Still I can highly recommend it to any one who needs a quick and simple place to sleep that is more comfortable as the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Joan-Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service and Amazing Product at an Affordable Price!
customer_reviews.text: This mat is pretty amazing and it’s affordable! I was skeptical how well it would really work but we took it on a 3 day hike and I slept great on it. No complaints whatsoever. I bought 2 of these and one came with a small cut in it so I contacted their customer service and they sent me a new one right away! The customer service is one of the best I’ve ever dealt with and that alone is worth a fortune to me. Very pleased with the product and company as a whole!
customer_reviews.author: SwaitMarketing

customer_reviews.title: Used 4 days in my living room. Flat.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a trip I never took. In closet for 5 months. Wife had shoulder surgery. She's sleeping on the couch for comfort. I'm sleeping on the floor in case she needs something. 4 days of use. Flat. No longer holds air. Can't contact seller. Less than a year old. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised by value, quality and comfort. Will be testing out on a longer trek shortly. Update 2/25/19. While these pads held up well on a 5 night trek shortly after purchase, they failed on a recent winter camping overnight when they deflated completely overnight. Thought it might be the cold, so tried it again at the house. Same result. No obvious leak. While less expensive than the Thermarest, etc. brands, these were not cheap. I wanted to love this, but cannot recommend and would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AK207

customer_reviews.title: Small, compact sleeping pad that deflates and bottoms out. :-(
customer_reviews.text: At 6', 215lbs with a 44" chest and a muscular frame, this sleeping pad is on the narrow side leaving my arms and shoulders to fall off the sides. While my 14-year daughter had no problems with the pad (other than sliding off in her sleeping bag when she slept), I bottomed out by simply laying on it (buttocks hitting the ground) and when I laid on my side (side touching the ground). It also seemed to deflate after around 4 hours wherein it had to be re-inflated. While this packs down amazingly-small and is an ultra-portable sleeping pad with solid reviews, I don't think it's a good fit for folks weighing above 180lbs and have muscular/wide builds.
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air
customer_reviews.text: The product leaks air. Used pad in late spring during a three week trip and after first several nights it started leaking air and was flat in about 30 minutes. Was used in mild conditions, always carefully checked the ground before placing the tent. Checked the pad for possible sources of leak, but could not identify the cause. There are no punctures or other damage, but it leaks. The product is unusable. Not happy with a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Artem

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all.  Go to REI
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2. One didn’t hold air from the first attempt. Went completely flat within 15 minutes. The other one worked. Reached out to the company to get a replacement and they won’t even bother with a reply. Pay extra and get it at REI. REI will always replace your products especially if they are faulty.
customer_reviews.author: skobrin

customer_reviews.title: 1 and Done.
customer_reviews.text: 1 year and only 2 camping trips removed from purchasing this product it no longer holds air. Woke up on the ground 2 hours after it was fully inflated. I initially loved this product, but a few months down the road I'm already looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Yatch

customer_reviews.title: Popped on the second night.
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this sleeping pad not provide sufficient insulation and is quite small, but it popped on my second night! I'm not a big guy (5,9 145lbs) however I found myself either sliding off in the middle of the night, or laying on the ground on top of the deflated pad. I'll never buy inflatable camping gear again.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Deflates after first use.
customer_reviews.text: After my first time using this product I loved it. I slept like a baby. But after trying it again after three more camping trips, this was a total waste. I'd wake up in the middle of the night to it completely deflated. I tried what other people recommended by not inflating it completely and that didn't work either. I'm only about 120lbs and rarely toss and turn in my sleep, but this slowly deflates flat within an hour. I've looked over the entire thing for holes and haven't found anything. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and compact!
customer_reviews.text: When this sleeping pad arrived I was thrilled with its small size rolled up in the bag. I blew it up in 10-15 breaths in the living room and laid on it for a while. I'm excited to try this camping as a side sleeper! It kept me off the ground much better than my previous sleeping pad. Easy to deflate, just make sure the valve is fully open. It also came with a little patch in case it pops a hole one day. I hope it lasts me years!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Super compact and convenient....but it got a small leak somewhere on it after first use. The deflating system isn’t the best either. You’ll never fold it back down to as small as it’s shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Detar

customer_reviews.title: one time use and that all I will try
customer_reviews.text: not comfortable at all. I would go with a memory foam or something softer when camping next time.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: It is light and comfortable, but mine deflates every two to three hours
customer_reviews.text: It is light and comfortable, but mine deflates every two to three hours. It is easy to inflate, but I would rather not be repeatedly inflating it. I would not recommend this one
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Defective - did not hold air for full night
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in advance for my son’s birthday. On his birthday we inflated it and it seemed ok. He took it on a camping trip and it did not hold air throughout the very first night. I emailed the seller and have yet to hear back. I am just outside of the 30 day return window based on the order date. I bought before his birthday and wrapped it without opening. I was so excited to give it to him and so disappointed it did not work. I hope the seller will make this right.
customer_reviews.author: Denise F.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad was great at first. It is light, compact and easy to blow up and fold up into its storage pouch. It stopped holding air after I used it a few times. I am 5’2 115lbs and a back sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable. Very uncomfortable. Used to camping and sleeping on mats, but this mat was exceptionally terrible. Your hips and shoulders touch the ground. Completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: mad-man2012

customer_reviews.title: Loses air.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this a few months ago and finally got to use it on a camping trip in NorCal. The first two nights were fine but on the third night it started to lose air and went completely flat. It will not hold air now and is completely worthless to me. I was very disappointed in the outcome of this product and am now stuck with it because it cannot be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Caruthers

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item. Had issues the first time. The adhesive that makes the single cell texture kept popping throughout the night. Besides my friends laughing at me all night in out tent, it was also very uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Odom

customer_reviews.title: ... a tent for one Night and it was the worst!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG - Had to use it in a tent for one Night and it was the worst!!!! Feels like your sleeping directly on the ground. I’m not heavy so that is not a factor. I would have been better off buying one at Walmart for $7.00 - Don’t buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! Will buy more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Boy Scout and he got to use it for the first time last night, to sleep on the floor at home while sick with a stomach bug instead of up in his bunk bed. It is amazingly easy to inflate, stays really firm and easy to deflate when done. Plus it packs down so small and compact. So much better than a "self inflating" one from King Camp I bought years ago... I will buy more of these eventually for my Cub Scout and my Girl Scout and probably for me because I am the one that ends up doing the camping trips. It is so amazing, excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Poor preformance doesn’t meet claims
customer_reviews.text: Definitely did miss my mattress after sleeping on this mat. The worst nights sleep I’ve had in years and felt like I might as well have been sleeping on the ground. I made sure I blew up the mat to the fullest extent and was quite suprised at how little it was blown up at full capacity. Definitely will not be using this product again and am very disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: A Recommended Sleeping Pad
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome sleep pad, just wish it were a little thicker. Feels great while sleeping on your side, but at times bottom out while sleeping on your back. I do recommend this sleeping pad and look forward to test it further.
customer_reviews.author: tsymborskiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Mountain Tough!
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight pad did great on our climb to the summit of South Sister this month! It blows up quickly (maybe a dozen big breaths?) and I was impressed how well it remained inflated, without requiring a "top off" even after three days. It's very lightweight and compact (a bit larger than a soda can when deflated) yet while inflated is full length/full width for an average-sized man and positively palatial for my wife. The tapered shape will allow it to fit inside most sleeping bags, although I kept it underneath my bag. Comfort was better than expected for a lightweight pad, probably best for tummy or back sleepers moreso than side sleepers.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Finally a padded pad for side sleepers and ultralight and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Have used many pads and never been impressed but this one is GREAT. I am side sleeper and this is the first and lightest one that I can get comfortable on!!! Very impressed. Folds to about 9" long by 3" across. Inflates to very long (see specs). Do have to huff and puff a bit 12-15 breathes) and the valve is quirky but the sleep was great. My go to pad now.
customer_reviews.author: PA hiker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible night.
customer_reviews.text: Went to camping over the weekend and one of the two sleep pad that we bought became flat. Had a bad back pain next morning. Looks like a leak somewhere but no time to figure out. We bought both same color. So, i have to now check which one was the bad one.
customer_reviews.author: TenzDorj

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic item for camping!
customer_reviews.text: This is unbelievable! It seems very thin but once you blow it up, it is very comfortable! We blew it up in a matter of seconds and refolded it into its bag with ease! We will be buying more for our kids when camping!
customer_reviews.author: Ginna Randall

customer_reviews.title: Deflates over night. Completely defective
customer_reviews.text: Thought this mat was awesome until I took it camping. It deflates overnight, constantly making it much more difficult to sleep on a bike tour. Disappointed I found out too late and can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolinebeeler

customer_reviews.title: It failed on my second camping trip
customer_reviews.text: I liked this pad because it was lightweight, comfortable and easy to blow up. However, it failed me on the second time I used it and I woke up on a deflated pad on the cold hard ground. Couldn't contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Ugh
customer_reviews.text: Brought these with me camping this past weekend. Even when "blown up" . . still feels like you are sleeping on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT resistant to tears
customer_reviews.text: After the first use, found several small tears; cause unknown. Junked.
customer_reviews.author: Surge

customer_reviews.title: I found this sleeping pad to be VERY difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: I found this sleeping pad to be VERY difficult to inflate...not the 10-15 breaths as described. I was also very difficult to deflate, way to heavy for my backpacking needs, and longer that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Loren C. Baim

customer_reviews.title: I bought this product because of the price and reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because of the price and reviews but this thing was awful. My back hurt and it slid around all night. I had a rough couple of nights with this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda E Hildebrandt

customer_reviews.title: Good but it loosing air after a few months of using it consistently
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping mat was really good when I first got it, after a few months of using it, it start loosing air when you leave it a lone or sleep on it. I need to find where the leak at so I can patch it or fix it. Good thing is that it came with a couple patches. Update: this sleeping pad is no longer good. It got deflated after 30 minutes of airing it up. It’s even faster when you lay on it, approximately 15 minutes after airing it up the pad will be deflated.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Thai

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: When I first took this out of the box I thought there is absolutely no way it’s going to be useful. Well, I was completely wrong. I am going to take it with me on my very first camping trip. I laid on it in the floor to test it out and so did my husband. I love it. It is so soft and it’s actually so much thicker than you would think. I’m going to order another one :-)
customer_reviews.author: CL Corlis

customer_reviews.title: Good night sleep
customer_reviews.text: A great sleeping pad. I have a klymit static v and was looking for a replacement. I actually need a couple more pads for multiple family members so I thought I would give this a shot. It took about 10-12 breaths to inflate and is super comfortable. I am a side sleeper and I was off the ground. I am 5’10” and the length is perfect. It also is a few oz less in weight and smaller when deflated then the klymit. It does have a lifetime warranty and it also comes with a patch kit. I am very happy with the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Darian R

customer_reviews.title: Mine not a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: First, there was delivery delay on this product. Now it has deflated with several gentle inside uses only.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa and Tom Paxson

customer_reviews.title: Better than high end sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad is awesome! I used it to sleep on a hardwood floor recently. Being a side sleeper it's usually a painful experience, especially in my hips. But this lightweight sleeping pad was really comfortable! I like that it is also relatively easy to roll it back up and get it back into its storage bag, which sometimes doesn't happen with the rest of my camping gear. I would definitely recommend this , and in fact, I plan to buy one for my brother for his Appalachian Trail adventures coming up.
customer_reviews.author: Liz frostenson

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping
customer_reviews.text: I found the product to be flimsy and uncomfortable- they say twelve breath and you can fill it up more like a hundred
customer_reviews.author: David J Lee

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from valve after two days.
customer_reviews.text: Won’t hold air after two regular uses. I spent the night freezing cold on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Went flat after one use
customer_reviews.text: Went flat after first use, failed on an important camping trip! Edit; the seller contacted me and sent a replacement 👍
customer_reviews.author: Devon Lee

customer_reviews.title: Went flat after third use
customer_reviews.text: I've used this sleeping pad for three trips, two nights each and it is already going flat. I've only slept on it four times because this last trip it was so flat I couldn't even use it. I keep it rolled up with my sleeping bag in a closet when not in use so it wasn't abused. Came back to amazon to buy a different brand and didn't realize I spent that much on this one. Definitely not worth it and I regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: alf0412

customer_reviews.title: Had a Defective Valve
customer_reviews.text: The one we got had a defective valve and couldn't hold air for more than a couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles N. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Stopped holding air during second use
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad stopped holding air just the second time I used it. I have yet to find a hole. This product is not durable at all and sadly was a huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Never held air all night..
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these blow up mats ... one held and one did not... First time... not great when you have a multi day cub scout weekend...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Prytko

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: blows up fast... too thin... can feel the ground. whats the point?
customer_reviews.author: EvenKeel

customer_reviews.title: Good, Fast and Cheap?
customer_reviews.text: Last sleeping pad was a Therm-a-Rest NeoAir Ultraight that cost over $225!! i developed a leak around the valve, as did a previous Therma-a Rest. The leak could not be patched as it was where the valve contacted the pad. Of course it was past the warrantee period. My new pad is lighter, blows up faster and is about as comfortable. I could buy 5 of the Outdoor lab pads with enough left over for a Starbucks. Time will tell how it holds up but so far this is a product that may disprove the theory you only get to pick two choices on the Good, Fast and Cheap scale. Thanks Trailhound - Austin TX
customer_reviews.author: Trailhound

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how anyone could find this comfortable. This is an awful excuse for a sleeping pad. It’s worse than a cheap air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Loses air after several uses.
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping pad worked nice for about 10 nights of camping. After that, it began losing air quickly. You end up waking up 2-3x and blowing it back up. I sent a message to the seller that claims a lifetime warranty, and have not heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Lasted three nights.
customer_reviews.text: We have used it twice for a total of three nights and it already doesn’t hold air. Cheap!!
customer_reviews.author: HCG

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true?
customer_reviews.text: No, it’s not too good to be true. Recent trip to Alaska. I needed to pack as light as possible so I bought this instead of taking my Thermarest. Don’t get me wrong, I like the Thermarest. This Outdoorsman Lab was excellent. Packed small, lightweight and comfortable! Spent 3 nights on it and couldn’t be happier. Temps got down to low 40’s. I’m 6’0” 225 lbs. Worked great for me. Kind of blown away at how tough this thing is. I didn’t baby it at all. I’m a big guy in a mummy bag and to roll over, it’s a little violent lol. This pad held up with no problem. Good purchase. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Scot H Stewart

customer_reviews.title: fill port leaks bad from day 1
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately, I did not try this before taking it on a trip for the first time. So when I needed it, I inflated it and it held some air for maybe 4 minutes. I found a hissing leak from the fill port and I suppose its caused by the distorted shape of both the check valve flap AND the press fitted cap. Totally unusable and I would have returned it had I evaluated it soon enough after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TX gadget nutTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I tried sleeping on the ground and it just didn't work. This was a lot cheaper than other sleeping pads, but still worth it! It's easy to inflate and stays inflated. I bought two and used them for my partner and I to social distance camp in the Rockies. It stayed inflated for 4 sleeps without me having to reinflate it. I did inflate it for a day before we used it. I sleep on my side and I could definitely feel the cold ground in the morning on my hip, but it wasn't uncomfortable to lay that way. Definitely a lot better than being on the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the price. Everyone I show it to laughs when I start blowing into it like a pool toy, but are usually impressed by how quickly it actually inflates. Comfort bed-like, as it's meant for "roughing it" after all, but it was still pretty easy on my back and hips compared to the ground. Side sleeping was possible, but was still a little rough on my arms and shoulder. Not painful, but not completely comfortable either. I would equate this with sleeping on your friend's really hard Ikea futon for a weekend; it will get the job done, but you'll still wish you were home in your own bed.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H.

customer_reviews.title: Only worked the first night !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 12 day fishing trip to Alaska to sleep in a tent each night. It stayed inflated the first night was was pretty comfortable. Each night after that it would deflate after just an hour or two. I’m not sure where the leak was and must have been very tiny. I’m going to return it. My friend paid $120 for one that lasted the entire trip and he had used it several trips before this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: cheep, get a pool float.
customer_reviews.text: amazon ad read best seller, for the money spent, go get several pool floats. really disappointed in this. to late for me to do anything. it will have to do for now.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Thin material punctures if you look at it wrong
customer_reviews.text: Material is thin and week. I thought i could use this to sleep on during wildland firefighting assignments but after 4 days it wouldnt hold air.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, easy to inflate, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad has made a huge difference in the quality of my sleep while outdoor camping. Easy to inflate, easy to deflate and easy to pack. Very comfortable, does not deflate during the night, just give it a blow before sleeping. It made a lot of difference compare to my usual sleeping pad. Worked for me (130lb) and for my husband (190lb) I can see this not being a good fit for some heavier/bigger people or people who moves a lot while sleeping. Highly recommended on my side
customer_reviews.author: Shamwow

customer_reviews.title: Very good mat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these considering the reviews, and I thought it was a gamble looking at the price and undecided if it was really worth. While I still think is a bit expensive, I do not regret it and bought two more for my kids. At the beginning I thought it was too thin, because it is thin. However, I'm about 240lbs, and I was able to sleep very comfortable while using it on gravel and not feel not one rock on my back. Very small and light, so it is a good item for backpacking. I recommended specially if you want to save space in your backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for the price, with comparable comfort to expensive S2S pads
customer_reviews.text: So far rather impressed. I have some real pricy sleeping pads for alpine and winter use, but needed something cheap and light for a friend who’s joining me on an upcoming trip. This was really easy to inflate, and had a “valve” to keep air in while inflating. It’s quite light and packs down smaller than a nalgene. It doesn’t have any internal insulation so I’d say it’s best as a summer pad. We’ll see how well it works in shoulder season but I imagine it will be adequate if you’re a warm sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: Inflates forever
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this I was so excited to use it. I didnt have any camping trips planned so I just put it next to my bed. It was super easy to inflate. Didnt take too many breaths which is a huge plus! It lasted on the floor for over 2+ weeks. I'm sure it wouldve stayed inflated had I not deflated it. When I finally did have a camping trip I took it with me and same experience super fast and easy setup and comfortable! I wish it was insulated! Love the little carrying bag it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for skinnier tall people
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for skinnier tall people. I took with me to Iceland for the campervan because I figured the van beds would be firm. I tried to use once and it kept a sliding from under me throughout the night so I gave up and pushed a side. It there was that felty type finish this would have reduced the sliding. It was easy to blow up and take air out and was about to pack it back up perfectly. So I will give credit to that. But the sliding around is the major design flaw. When not sliding around was comfy.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay inflated
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the box, inflated it for my first trip, and it became deflated by the time I got back into the tent (within 10 minutes). I thought it was a fluke and tried it again and it was completely flat within 5 minutes. I can't see where the hole is but I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Love this sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping pad. Used it camping several times. It takes me about 16-18 good breaths to fill it, not long at all. It is very light weight. I like the dark blue color. It tappers down by the feet, but is it comfortable, don't feel like I'm falling off; even has room for my Jack Russel to lay by my feet. I'm a stomach sleeper too, so that can make a difference. We need a little more squishy-ness than back sleepers, and less than side sleepers. I also brought it with me back home for xmas, this made sleeping on a flat futon so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: useless.
customer_reviews.text: It never stayed filled up properly. No matter the amount of weight put on it, it never held it's shape and lost air. I even tried to swap sides. never worked. useless.
customer_reviews.author: Flyingnmomma

customer_reviews.title: true to description
customer_reviews.text: took on a 3 day hike, yes light weight,yes folds up small about size of a waterbottle took up no room at all, feels ok when sleeping on,but..... only complaint is it was so loud when moving around it rubbed against bottom of tent like 2 rubber ballooons being rubbed kinda annoying had to put some clothes under to keep it quiet suggest bringing a lightweight under sheet or something to keep from the pad rubbing against tent did its job though with no air leakage
customer_reviews.author: Ernie A

customer_reviews.title: Punctured instantly.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two identical pads. Within two days both had punctured and were unusable. Made of a very thin and easily breakable material. Very unfortunate because otherwise seemed like a great product -- good price, easily compressible. But the material is simply not high quality.
customer_reviews.author: ckromm@yahoo.com

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold air
customer_reviews.text: Used it a couple of times before the pad starting deflating over night. Expected better quality with this product. Update: the company replaced it and new one works great
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need and want!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this thing! Blows up in a few breaths, so comfortable to lay on, and more compact and lightweight than I could have imagined! It holds air so well I had to open the valve and let a little air out the first night because it was so firm. I tucked my sleeping pad inside my sleeping bag to make sure the slick sleeping bag didn't slide off the pad. It was so comfortable even sleeping directly on it without the sleeping bag in between. I am so very happy with this purchase. I would change nothing about this wonderful piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very compact, seems well-constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice so far. I'm a side-sleeper, so a pad is a must when I'm camping. This inflates in about 10 breaths just as advertised and rolls up into a very compact bag. I'm 6 foot 1, 185 lbs and this is comfortable for me. Plenty long and wide and keeps my hip off the ground. Comes with a couple patches, too. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: H. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy for having an extra bed for visitors or yourself !
customer_reviews.text: I have been sleeping more in the studio / home office , so the need came for something to make the futton more comfortable. This is the perfect size for it. Just place some bed sheets on top of it and you'll have yourself an extra (almost) single bed without all the hasle. Was able to inflate it in about ten blows. Now , as everything well packed you won't be able to factory pack it back again , so save yourself the trouble and grab a resealable bag and that's it ! .
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Great design.  Tough but lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: My son slept on this for 6 nights while we camped and backpacked. When I opened it and saw how big it was, I was like no way this thing inflates in 9-10 breaths. BUT IT DID. Not only that, but it provides ample cushion to sleep comfortably. I laid on it for a couple of hours and was quite comfy. No complaints and it is very comfy. No snags or leaks on our almost week-long trip. I think it's really great. I'd suggest pairing this with a closed cell foam pad to keep warm in the colder months and to keep from sliding around the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Halli E. Gaddis Bovia

customer_reviews.title: This mat deflated on day one use!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally disappointed with this mat. Took out during a hiking trip without using it beforehand. To say the list may deflated middle of the night leaving me cold in a winter night.
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: More than just for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Won’t leave home without it! Bought this to take camping in Africa. Mattresses here are marginal most times. Thought to whip this puppy out and put on top of my mattress - genius!!! Excellent support. I use it all the time now, and it’s a travel staple. Bought a second just for backup - that’s how much I love it. Great company too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Haney

customer_reviews.title: A Real Bargain
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten to the age (54) where i am very concerned with being comfortable. I love backpacking, but I hate being miserable at night I have been too miserly and i didn't want to spend the big bucks on a high end pad. I was using the inexpensive closed cell foam pads. When i read the reviews and saw the price, i had to pull the trigger. This thing is beautiful. I have not used it in the field yet, but at home it feels extremely comfortable and large enough to cover your entire body. I also love the compact size and feather weight.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Deflates easily
customer_reviews.text: Loved this until it stopped staying inflated. Now I can’t use it at all and I only had it for 2 months, what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Outdoorsman Lab Sleeping Pad for Camping - Patented Camp Mat, Ultralight - Best Compact Inflatable Air Mattress for Adults & Kids - Lightweight Hiking, Backpacking, Outdoor & Travel Gear
feature_bullets: PATENTED (Patent number: D802,336) SLEEPING BAG PAD TECHNOLOGY: Our camping mat has a patented design that conforms to your body shape. You’ll wake up refreshed, energized, and ready to explore nature.

ULTRA-LIGHT COMFORTABLE CAMPING PAD: The perfect sleeping pad for camping & addition to your backpacking gear. Sleep even better under the stars with a mattress that fits a wide range of sleeping bags.

BUILT TO LAST: Our thick, durable camping mat is made of lightweight, flexible, abrasion-resistant Nylon. The high-quality material used for our sleeping pads is water and rip resistant ensuring you will enjoy it for many camping trips to come.

EASY INFLATION & DEFLATION: Our self inflating camping mat has an easy-to-use air valve for quick inflation (10-15 breaths). A few more breaths provide extra firmness & support. Your camping accessories are incomplete without this camping sleeping pad.
USA-BASED FAMILY-OWNED BUSINESS: We will respond in less than 24 hrs. We offer a 30-day refund. Free replacement and no return needed.
